title: Automatic Compilation of Dependent Classes[edit]
content:
In Java, if you have used any reference to any other java object, then the class for that object will be automatically compiled, if that was not compiled already. These automatic compilations are nested, and this continues until all classes are compiled that are needed to run the program. So it is usually enough to compile only the high level class, since all the dependent classes will be automatically compiled.Main class compilation

javac ... MainClass.javaHowever, you can't rely on this feature if your program is using reflection to create objects, or you are compiling for servlets or for a "jar", package. In these cases you should list these classes for explicit compilation.Main class compilation

javac ... MainClass.java ServletOne.java ...
